intro: Amalia acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed amalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Amalia acuminata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and showy blooms.
